===Kayvan Sabeghi arrest===
===Kayvan Sabeghi arrest===
â
Kayvan Sabeghi, a former [[United States Army Rangers|U.S. Army Ranger]] who served in the [[Iraq War]] and the [[War in Afghanistan (2001âpresent)|War in Afghanistan]], was seriously injured while being arrested by police that evening. He was walking away from the late evening protest when he was stopped by police. <ref>{{cite news|last=Gabbatt|first=Adam|title=Occupy Oakland: second Iraq war veteran injured after police clashes|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/nov/04/occupy-oakland-second-veteran-injured|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=The Guardian|date=November 4, 2011}}</ref> The organization [[Iraq Veterans Against the War]] issued a statement saying that "police struck Sabeghi with nightsticks on his hands, shoulders, ribs and back, and that in addition to a lacerated [[spleen]] he suffered from internal bleeding." After 18 hours of being denied medical treatment while in police custody he was transferred to [[Highland Hospital (Oakland, California)|Highland Hospital]] and put into the intensive care unit. <ref name=kayvan_reuters>{{cite news|last=Randewich|first=Noel|title=Army veteran injured in Oakland clashes with police|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/11/05/us-protests-oakland-veteran-idUSTRE7A37A820111105|accessdate=6 November 2011|newspaper=Reuters|date=4 November 2011}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|title=Kayvan Sabeghi Injured: Second Iraq war vet hurt during Oakland clash with police|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/11/05/kayvan-sabeghi-injured_n_1077806.html|accessdate=5 November 2011|newspaper=Huffington Post|date=5 November 2011}}</ref>
+
Kayvan Sabeghi, a former [[United States Army Rangers|U.S. Army Ranger]] who served in the [[Iraq War]] and the [[War in Afghanistan (2001âpresent)|War in Afghanistan]], was seriously injured while being arrested by police that evening. He was walking away from the late evening protest when he was stopped by police. <ref>{{cite news|last=Gabbatt|first=Adam|title=Occupy Oakland: second Iraq war veteran injured after police clashes|url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2011/nov/04/occupy-oakland-second-veteran-injured|accessdate=November 6, 2011|newspaper=The Guardian|date=November 4, 2011}}</ref> Arrest records show Sabeghi was booked on "suspicion of resisting arrest". <ref>[http://www.armytimes.com/news/2011/11/ap-iraq-war-veteran-hurt-occupy-protests-110511/ Another Iraq veteran hurt in Occupy protests]</ref>
  +   +
The organization [[Iraq Veterans Against the War]] issued a statement saying that "police struck Sabeghi with nightsticks on his hands, shoulders, ribs and back, and that in addition to a lacerated [[spleen]] he suffered from internal bleeding." After 18 hours of being denied medical treatment while in police custody he was transferred to [[Highland Hospital (Oakland, California)|Highland Hospital]] where he underwent emergency surgery for a ruptured spleen. <ref name=kayvan_reuters>{{cite news|last=Randewich|first=Noel|title=Army veteran injured in Oakland clashes with police|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/11/05/us-protests-oakland-veteran-idUSTRE7A37A820111105|accessdate=6 November 2011|newspaper=Reuters|date=4 November 2011}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|title=Kayvan Sabeghi Injured: Second Iraq war vet hurt during Oakland clash with police|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/11/05/kayvan-sabeghi-injured_n_1077806.html|accessdate=5 November 2011|newspaper=Huffington Post|date=5 November 2011}}</ref>
